intro: Ebenus geminata, commonly known as the twin-stemmed euphorbia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a succulent shrub characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Ebenus geminata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
